item.title: Amazon Just Dropped Its Game-Changing AI Models – Here's What You Need to Know
item.tags: Tech, Technews, amazon, AmazonNova, AI
item.author: Sukhbir Cheema
item.description: The Nova lineup comprises six models tailored to diverse needs.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

﻿

Amazon has made a bold play in the generative AI arena with the launch of its Nova family

At its AWS re:Invent event on 4 December, the tech giant revealed its suite of foundation models designed to rival Microsoft, Google, Meta, and OpenAI.

While its competitors have long dominated the AI headlines, Amazon is leveraging its leadership in cloud computing to carve its niche.  

Until now, Amazon Web Services (AWS) focused on hosting third-party models, including those from its partner, Anthropic.﻿

This new move signals Amazon's shift towards developing its proprietary generative AI technologies

According to Rohit Prasad, Amazon's senior vice president leading the AI charge, Nova models are crafted to address challenges encountered by developers building applications.  

The Nova lineup comprises six models tailored to diverse needs, from text processing to creative content generation.

Standout offerings include Nova Canvas for image creation and Nova Reel for video production, with Nova Premiere set to launch next year to handle complex reasoning.

The Nova models, designed to support 200 languages, boast high customisability, allowing businesses to fine-tune them using proprietary data.

Amazon claims its Nova models are not only faster but also 75% more cost-effective compared to competitors' solutions on AWS

Such affordability and efficiency could make them appealing for enterprises eager to integrate AI without significant infrastructure investments.  

Safety and usability remain a priority. The models, available via AWS’s Bedrock service, come with guidelines to ensure responsible application, whether for creative tasks or advanced problem-solving.  

Amazon's Nova models underscore the company's intent to innovate and compete aggressively in a field dominated by its rivals. With its cloud dominance and now proprietary AI capabilities, Amazon seems poised to challenge the status quo in generative AI.  

Watch Amazon announce the launch of Nova in the video below:

Follow SAYS Tech on Facebook, Instagram, & TikTok for the latest in tech in Malaysia and the world!

item.title: 14 Bars & Restaurants In KL To Celebrate New Year's Eve This Year
item.tags: sayseats, eats, rooftops, bars, events, parties, klnightlife, nightlife, drinks, restaurants, newyearseve, newyears, alcohol
item.author: Tamara Jayne
item.description: Ring in the new year with stunning city skyline views.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

1. Troika Sky Dining

For a rooftop experience with plenty of options, Troika Sky Dining is the place to go. You can choose between Mr. Chew's Chino Latino for a mix of Latin flavors, Strato for top-tier Italian, Fritz for fine European dining, or Fuego for a fiery Latin American vibe. You're spoiled for choice, and the views make everything even better!

Mr Chew's

Address:

Level 23A, The Troika, 19 Persiaran KLCC, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

Strato

Address: 

Level 23A, The Troika, 19 Persiaran KLCC, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

Fritz

Address:

Level 23A, The Troika, 19 Persiaran KLCC, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

Fuego

Address:

Level 23A, The Troika, 19 Persiaran KLCC, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

2. Wet Deck, W Kuala Lumpur

If you're ready to party in style, Wet Deck's 'Electrify the Sky 2.0: White Edition' is where it's at! With an all-white dress code, a lineup of powerhouse DJs, and a spectacular rooftop view, this party guarantees a wild, unforgettable night as you welcome 2025.

Address:

W Kuala Lumpur, 121 Jalan Ampang, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

7pm till late

3. Jann

For a more sophisticated night out, Jann at Alila Villas offers a peaceful, elegant atmosphere with incredible views. It's perfect for those looking to enjoy world-class cuisine and cocktails in a luxurious yet understated setting.﻿

Address:

Level 1, Alila Villas, Jalan Stesen Sentral 5, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

6pm – 1am

4. Terrazza KL

Offering a Mediterranean-inspired vibe, Terrazza is ideal for those who want to enjoy a more relaxed and scenic celebration. The views, the music, and the atmosphere all come together for a perfect night to ring in 2025.﻿

Address:

Yap Ah Shak House, 17, Jalan Yap Ah Shak,

Chow Kit, 50300 Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

5. SANTAI Pool Bar & Lounge

Kick back at SANTAI at EQ Kuala Lumpur, where the vibes are relaxed, the cocktails are flowing, and the views are just beautiful. Whether you want to chill by the pool or dance the night away, this place has it all for a fun New Year's Eve.

Address:

EQ Kuala Lumpur, 13 Jalan Raja Chulan, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

11am – 2am

6. Alva KL

For a quieter, more intimate rooftop experience, Alva KL delivers. The modern, sleek vibe makes it perfect for enjoying some quality drinks and conversation, all while taking in the breathtaking city views.

Address:

19 Jalan Kia Peng, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

7. Man Tao Bar

Located in Hotel Stripes KL, Man Tao Bar is your go-to for a sophisticated, low-key celebration.

Enjoy expertly crafted cocktails in a sleek, contemporary setting, making it a chill but stylish choice to toast the new year.

Address:

25, Jalan Kamunting,

Chow Kit, 50300 Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

11am – 3am

8. Helipad Kuala Lumpur

This one's a must-see! Helipad KL, as its name suggests, is a big helipad that has been transformed into a rooftop bar. Expect 360-degree views of KL, exceptional cocktails, and a buzzing atmosphere that's ideal for a memorable celebration.

Address:

34 Menara KH, 8 Jalan Sultan Ismail, Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – 2am

9. Vertigo

Located in Banyan Tree, Vertigo offers a combination of luxury and breathtaking views that make it perfect for those looking to celebrate in style. With both an elegant atmosphere and a killer cocktail list, it's the perfect venue for an extraordinary New Year's Eve celebration.﻿

Address:

Level 59, Banyan Tree Kuala Lumpur,

2, Jalan Conlay, Vertigo, 50450 Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

10. THIRTY8 Restaurant

THIRTY8 at Grand Hyatt combines stunning views with fine dining. Offering a sophisticated environment and a menu that's as impressive as the view, it's the place to be if you're looking to celebrate with a little extra class.

Address:

Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur,

12, Jalan Pinang, Kuala Lumpur,

50450 Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

6.30am – 11pm

11. SkyBar

Perched atop Traders Hotel, SkyBar is one of the most iconic rooftop spots in KL, offering sweeping views of the PETRONAS Twin Towers. Sip on cocktails by the pool and take in the city lights while partying into the new year!

Address:

Level 33, Traders Hotel,

Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

12. Bar Trigona

Bar Trigona at Four Seasons Hotel brings innovation to the bar scene with creative cocktails made from local ingredients. With a sophisticated yet laid-back vibe, it's a great place to sip something unique and welcome the new year in style.

Address:

Four Seasons Hotel, 145 Jalan Ampang, Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – 1am

13. Roofino Skydining

Roofino offers a more refined dining experience with panoramic views of the KL skyline. Whether you're there for the food, drinks, or views, this spot is perfect for those who want a more chill but stylish atmosphere for ushering the new year.

Address:

Block C, 338, Jalan Tun Razak,

Kampung Datuk Keramat, 55000 Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

5pm – Late

14. Mantra Rooftop Bar & Lounge

For a more relaxed but trendy vibe, Mantra is the perfect place to sip on some craft cocktails and enjoy a fun atmosphere. The views and the overall ambiance make it a great spot to vibe out as you head into the new year.

Address:

Bangsar Village II, Jalan Telawi 1, 59100 Kuala Lumpur

Opening hours:

4.30pm – 1am

Check out more places for drinks:

Get a fresh makeover and pamper yourself before the year ends:

item.title: Monk Looks Like Shin-Chan With DIY Black Tape Eyebrows To Beat Facial Recognition Fail
item.tags: fun, funny, tech, fail, facialrecognition, monk, thailand
item.author: Celine Low
item.description: Who knew eyebrows could make such a difference?
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

A Thai monk found himself in a 'sticky' situation when a facial recognition fail system failed to identify him due to his lack of eyebrows

The monk was attempting to use his state welfare card at a grocery store in Khon Kaen, Thailand to purchase items for religious purposes.

However, the store's facial recognition system repeatedly failed to recognise his face, stating that it didn't match the photo registered with his welfare card, reported Thaiger.

The store vendor noticed that the scanning system could not detect the monk's eyes properly and decided to get creative.﻿

With help from a kind customer, they cut pieces of black electrical tape and stuck them to his brow bone to create makeshift eyebrows

Without much protest, the monk embraced his new look, resembling the popular cartoon character Shin-chan. Then, he calmly faced the scanner and hilariously (and amazingly), it worked!

The transaction was successful.

The vendor and the monk burst into laughter, with the vendor even holding up a small mirror so the monk could see the results of their impromptu handiwork.

The incident, captured on CCTV on 1 December, was shared on Facebook and has gone viral on social media, even making headlines on local news stations in Thailand.

According to Khaosod English, the vendor explained that the 45-year-old monk was a regular customer at her store before his ordination.﻿

"After multiple failed scan attempts, I considered asking him to return to the temple and try again later. Instead, we tried applying black electrical tape as makeshift eyebrows, similar to Shin-chan's style," she said.

Watch the full clip here:

Here are some stories where people came up with creative solutions for their problems:

item.title: Vivy Yusof, Suami Mengaku Tak Bersalah Pecah Amanah Dana Pelaburan Khazanah & PNB RM8 Juta
item.tags: vivyyusof, fadzaanuar, fashionvalet, pecahamanah, khazanah, PNB, pelaburan, dana, perkongsian, seismik
item.author: Dania Hamdan
item.description: Vivy dan Fadzaruddin masing-masing dibenarkan dijamin RM100,000 dengan seorang penjamin bersama-sama syarat tambahan.
item.content:encoded:
Follow kami di WhatsApp Channels, Telegram, Instagram dan TikTok SAYS Seismik, jadi antara yang terawal untuk dapatkan berita serta artikel-artikel menarik.

Pengasas platform e-dagang FashionValet, Datin Vivy Yusof dan suaminya, Datuk Fadzaruddin Shah Anuar mengaku tidak bersalah di Mahkamah Sesyen Kuala Lumpur atas pertuduhan pecah amanah melibatkan dana pelaburan Khazanah Nasional Berhad (Khazanah) dan Permodalan Nasional Berhad (PNB) berjumlah RM8 juta enam tahun lalu

Menurut laporan Harian Metro, kedua-dua mereka membuat pengakuan itu selepas pertuduhan dikemukakan di hadapan Hakim Rosli Ahmad.

Mengikut pertuduhan, mereka dengan niat bersama sebagai ejen iaitu Pengarah Fashion Valet Sdn Bhd (FV) dan di dalam kapasiti itu diamanahkan dengan harta iaitu dana pelaburan Khazanah dan PNB melakukan pecah amanah jenayah ke atas dana pelaburan itu di mana dengan curangnya membuat pembayaran berjumlah RM8 juta daripada akaun bank milik syarikat FV kepada syarikat, 30 Maple Sdn Bhd tanpa kelulusan ahli lembaga pengarah syarikat itu.

Difahamkan, kesalahan itu dilakukan di sebuah cawangan bank di Plaza Damansara Bukit Damansara pada 21 Ogos 2018.

Pertuduhan mengikut Seksyen 409 Kanun Keseksaan yang dibaca bersama Seksyen 34 kanun sama, yang jika sabit kesalahan boleh dihukum penjara maksimum 20 tahun dengan sebatan serta denda

Terdahulu, Timbalan Pendakwa Raya, Datuk Wan Shaharuddin Wan Ladin memohon jaminan RM100,000 hingga RM200,000 setiap seorang dengan seorang penjamin.

"Pendakwaan juga mohon syarat tambahan supaya pasangan ini menyerahkan pasport antarabangsa kepada mahkamah, melapor diri di pejabat SPRM Kuala Lumpur sebulan sekali dan tidak mengganggu saksi pendakwaan," katanya.

Walau bagaimanapun, peguam yang mewakili suami isteri terbabit iaitu Ashok Athimulan memohon jaminan munasabah berikutan kedua-dua anak guam menetap di Kuala Lumpur.

"Kami memohon jaminan rendah juga memandangkan semua aset mereka sudah dibekukan dan kini bergantung kewangan daripada rakan dan ahli keluarga untuk membayar wang jaminan," katanya.

Mendengar hujah kedua-dua pihak, Rosli membenarkan Vivy dan Fadzaruddin masing-masing dijamin RM100,000 dengan seorang penjamin dengan syarat tambahan seperti dimohon pendakwaan.

Mahkamah turut menetapkan sebutan semula kes pada 22 Januari depan.

item.title: Bungkus Kaw Kaw Is Now Halal-Certified
item.tags: news, bungkuskawkaw, halalcert, halal, brand, f&b, jakim
item.author: Yap Wan Xiang
item.description: This comes after the brand faced scrutiny in September for not having halal certification.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

Bungkus Kaw Kaw has announced that it is officially halal-certified

In a press release today, 5 December, the local food and beverage (F&B) chain shared its pride in receiving halal certification from the Malaysia Islamic Development Department (JAKIM), marking a significant milestone for the brand.

"Bungkus Kaw Kaw aims to meet the diverse needs of Muslims by offering halal-certified authentic Malaysian favourite food and drinks.

"This step is taken to create an environment of trust, inclusivity, and culinary excellence for all," the statement read.

The brand emphasised that the certification serves as a crucial indicator of trust for Muslim diners.

It also revealed that the F&B chain adhered rigorously to specific standards and guidelines, dedicating significant time and resources to meet these requirements.

"This commitment reflects the restaurant's dedication to upholding the integrity of halal food," it added.

In early September, the brand came under scrutiny after JAKIM confirmed that it was one of the five popular restaurant chains that were not halal-certified

The news surprised many, as the F&B chain operates over 60 outlets in major shopping malls across Selangor, Kuala Lumpur, Putrajaya, and Negeri Sembilan.

In response to the issue, Bungkus Kaw Kaw explained that it shared the same central kitchen as Ah Cheng Laksa, which is halal-certified. The brand also stated its commitment to securing halal certification for its outlets by the end of the year.

Below is a video of Bungkus Kaw Kaw announcing its halal certification:

Ayam Penyet Best, Dolly Dim Sum, and Bungkus Kaw Kaw were among the brands that JAKIM confirmed were not halal-certified in September:

In August, the brand faced criticism for not including sambal in one of their nasi lemak offerings:

item.title: 5 Negeri Di Malaysia Ini Tidak Akan Cuti Umum 'Tahun Baharu' Pada 1 Januari 2025
item.tags: cutiumum, cutiumum2025, cutitahunbaru, 1januari, 2025, tahunbaru, newyear, tahunbaru2025, tahunbaharu2025, cutitahunbaharu, seismik
item.author: Akmal Redzwan
item.description: Penduduk di lima buah negeri ini perlu bekerja seperti biasa.
item.content:encoded:
Follow kami di Telegram, Instagram dan TikTok SAYS Seismik, jadi antara yang terawal untuk dapatkan berita serta artikel-artikel menarik.

Ramai rakyat Malaysia sedang bersiap sedia untuk tahun baharu yang akan datang dan sibuk merancang percutian bersama keluarga

Tetapi, tahukah anda bahawa hari Rabu, 1 Januari 2025, bukanlah cuti umum kebangsaan untuk seluruh negeri.

Walaupun kebanyakan negeri di Malaysia akan menikmati cuti sehari, pejabat dan jabatan kerajaan di beberapa buah negeri tetap akan beroperasi seperti biasa.

Bagi penduduk Johor, Kedah, Kelantan, Perlis, dan Terengganu, Hari Tahun Baharu tidak diisytiharkan sebagai cuti umum

Negeri-negeri ini mempunyai keutamaan budaya dan wilayah yang unik bagi membentuk jadual cuti umum mereka.

Negeri seperti Kelantan dan Terengganu, yang menggunakan Jumaat dan Sabtu sebagai hujung minggu, sering mengutamakan cuti yang berkaitan dengan tradisi Islam dan adat resam dan budaya tempatan berbanding dengan acara global seperti Hari Tahun Baharu.

Walaupun tidak diisytiharkan sebagai cuti umum, sambutan Malam Tahun Baharu masih diadakan di negeri-negeri ini

Bandar-bandar besar seperti Johor Bahru dan Alor Setar masih mengadakan acara countdown, pertunjukan bunga api, dan festival Malam Tahun Baharu bagi membolehkan orang ramai sama-sama menyertai suasana perayaan, walaupun mereka perlu bekerja pada keesokan harinya.

Jika anda bekerja di syarikat swasta di lima negeri ini, adalah lebih baik untuk mengesahkan dengan majikan anda sama ada syarikat anda akan cuti pada Hari Tahun Baharu atau tidak.

Sama ada anda menikmati cuti umum atau perlu bekerja, semoga Tahun Baharu 2025 nanti bakal menjadi permulaan yang indah buat semua!

item.title: FashionValet Founders Vivy Yusof & Husband Plead Not Guilty To RM8 Million CBT Charge
item.tags: news, fashionvalet, vivyyusof, CBT, PNB, khazanah, MACC
item.author: May Vin Ang
item.description: The court granted bail at RM100,000 and ordered the couple to surrender their passports.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

FashionValet founders Datin Vivy Yusof and her husband, Datuk Fadzarudin Shah Anuar, were charged today, 5 December, with criminal breach of trust (CBT) involving RM8 million investment funds six years ago

According to the New Straits Times, Vivy, 37, and Fadzarudin, 36, pleaded not guilty to the charge when it was read before Judge Rosli Ahmad at the Kuala Lumpur Sessions Court.

As directors of FashionValet Sdn Bhd, the couple is accused of conspiring to commit CBT involving funds entrusted to them by government-linked companies, Khazanah Nasional Berhad and Permodalan Nasional Berhad (PNB)

They allegedly transferred RM8 million from FashionValet's bank account to 30 Maple Sdn Bhd without the approval of FashionValet's board of directors.

30 Maple, which operates the luxury headscarf brand dUCK, is also owned by the couple.

The alleged offence occurred at the Public Bank Berhad branch in Bukit Damansara on 21 August 2018.﻿

The charge, framed under Section 409 of the Penal Code and read alongside Section 34, carries a sentence of two to 20 years in prison, whipping, and a fine, if convicted

The court granted bail at RM100,000 and required the couple to report to the Kuala Lumpur Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) office monthly.

The judge also ordered the couple to surrender their passports to the court and warned them not to harass or influence any witnesses related to the case.

The case is set for mention on 22 January.

Read more about the FashionValet saga here:

item.title: Cake Shop Employees Surprise Aunty After Seeing Her Celebrate Birthday Alone
item.tags: fun, bestof2024, feelgood, tamanmelawati, kualalumpur, birthday, cake, dessertcafe, patisserie, heartwarming
item.author: Yap Wan Xiang
item.description: Who is cutting onions? (˃̣̣̥⌓˂̣̣̥ )
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

Employees of a cake shop in Taman Melawati, Kuala Lumpur, have won netizens' hearts for throwing a surprise birthday celebration for an aunty who was at the store alone

In a video posted yesterday, 4 December, Sundaydo HQ shared the story of a middle-aged woman coming to their store to purchase a piece of cake.

After employees learned it was her birthday, storefront employee Eryn offered the aunty the cake for free. The aunty insisted on paying, but Eryn refused to accept her money.

"After a few minutes, we realised that the aunty was celebrating her birthday and blowing the candles alone.

"She then said she wanted to go to a shop nearby for a while," read the caption of the video.

Once she left, the team seized the opportunity to prepare a surprise for her

"The team was excited to give the aunty a surprise once she was back.

"The aunty came back and offered some biscuits to Eryn in exchange for the free cake.

"Little did she know that we wanted to surprise and celebrate her birthday together," Sundaydo HQ wrote.

The team became teary-eyed as they sang Happy Birthday, with some seen wiping their tears.

The aunty also appeared moved, wiping her tears with a tissue.

"Seeing her smile and feeling her happiness with our cakes and our gesture is what keeps us going," they said.

Speaking to SAYS, Sundaydo HQ expressed their happiness and gratitude for being able to celebrate the aunty's birthday

They also mentioned feeling "overwhelmed by all the kind responses and prayers" received from the video.﻿

At the time of writing, the video has garnered over 1.7 million views on Instagram

"I live nearby. And after seeing this absolute drama, I'll be coming to the shop to support you more often. Y'all are something else. In this cruel world, it's rare to see this kind of gem. Much respect to y'all," read a top comment.

"Thank you for being kind. It cost you nothing but you won the hearts of everyone in return. Well done, team," said a netizen, while another joked, "You guys sell cakes or onions?"

Watch the video here:

Here are more heartwarming stories on SAYS:

item.title: Red Floodwaters In Kelantan Spark Mystery: Here's What Caused The Unusual Phenomenon
item.tags: news, flood, mystery, kelantan, factory
item.author: Aleya Natasha Mohd Ali
item.description: The red water was caused by a nearby chilli sauce factory.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

A recent video showing floodwaters in Kampung Telaga Bata, Kelantan, turning an alarming bright red has gone viral

The video, posted by @azamjusoh on TikTok, revealed a large area of red floodwater surrounding a house.

As the camera panned, it became clear that the red water was mixing with the usual floodwater in the area.

The unusual sight quickly caught the attention of netizens, garnering 1.2 million views

The video, however, was posted without any explanation, leaving netizens puzzled about the source of the red water.

"Why does the water look like that? Did paint spill?" one user commented.

"The paint spilled; someone was trying to paint the house but ended up spilling it," another used suggested.

The video's uploader later clarified that the red water originated from food colouring, specifically from a nearby chilli sauce factory

After learning the cause, users began questioning how much food colouring was spilled to create such an effect.

"How many bottles of red colouring were poured in?" one user asked.

"Oh, so that sauce uses a lot of colouring, right?" asked another.

Read more recent #news on SAYS:

item.title: Grab Singapore Unveils Adorable Mini Uniforms That Labubu Dolls Can Wear
item.tags: fun, labubu, Grab, uniforms, miniature, singapore, cute
item.author: Celine Low
item.description: So cute!
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

Grab Singapore has unveiled adorable miniature uniforms designed specifically for Labubu dolls

Exclusively for Grab's delivery partners, the e-hailing company has come up with a mini version of their signature green uniform, complete with a functional zipper and a mini GrabFood delivery bag with adjustable straps.

The vest-pocket uniform set will be available from 16 December onwards on the GrabFood Gear app, priced at SGD29.90 (approximately RM99).

Miniature clothes for Labubu seem to be all the rage

In November, the Singapore Prison Service shared photos of women inmates creating crochet outfits for these mischievous-looking dolls.

These crocheted Labubu outfits were made available for sale to fans, with all proceeds supporting the reintegration and rehabilitation efforts of inmates and ex-offenders in Singapore. 

Meanwhile, POP MART also shared photos submitted by fans who dressed up their Labubu dolls in colourful mini outfits.

Malaysians have also been sharing their impressive collection of Labubu dolls:

Read more fun stories here:

item.title: Hanya Disebabkan Vape, Anak Sanggup Tikam Ibu Sampai Mati
item.tags: anakbunuhibu, tikamibu, vape, kesbunuh, berita, tragedi, kematian, perkongsian, seismik
item.author: Dania Hamdan
item.description: Astagfirullahaladzim, takutnya manusia zaman sekarang.
item.content:encoded:
Follow kami di WhatsApp Channels, Telegram, Instagram dan TikTok SAYS Seismik, jadi antara yang terawal untuk dapatkan berita serta artikel-artikel menarik.

Seorang wanita maut disyaki ditikam dengan pisau oleh anak kandungnya di FELDA Ayer Hitam, Kluang, Johor pada 4 Disember 2024

Menurut laporan Kosmo!, dalam kejadian kira-kira pukul 10.45 pagi itu, wanita berusia 50-an meninggal dunia di tangan anaknya yang berusia 20-an akibat cedera ditikam pada bahagian pinggang.

Difahamkan, sebelum ketika kejadian, berlaku pertengkaran antara suspek dan ibunya kerana ibunya menegur suspek menghisap vape.

Akibat berang dengan bebelan ibunya, suspek bertindak menikam mangsa dari arah belakang ketika sedang menikmati sarapan pagi di dapur.

Sementara itu, Ketua Polis Daerah Kluang, Asisten Komisioner Bahrin Mohd Noh mengesahkan kejadian itu dan mangsa dikejarkan ke Hospital Enche Besar Hajjah Khalsom (HEBHK) sebelum disahkan meninggal dunia pada pukul 11 pagi

"Susulan kejadian itu, seorang lelaki warga tempatan berusia 20 tahun ditahan ditempat kejadian oleh sepasukan pegawai daripada Bahagian Siasatan Jenayah, Ibu Pejabat Polis Daerah (IPD) Kluang dan Balai Polis Sri Lalang," katanya.

Menurutnya, semakan mendapati suspek tidak mempunyai sebarang rekod jenayah lampau manakala ujian air kencing pula mendapati tiada pengaruh dadah.

Like Facebook, follow Twitter dan Instagram SAYS Seismik serta temui segala cerita 'mesti kongsi' sekarang!

Baca lagi artikel menarik hanya di SAYS Seismik:

item.title: 24-Year-Old Aspiring Teacher From KL Wins Miss World Malaysia 2024
item.tags: news, missworld, missworldmalaysia, beautypageant, pageant
item.author: May Vin Ang
item.description: She will represent Malaysia at the Miss World pageant next year.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

A 24-year-old aspiring teacher from Kuala Lumpur has been crowned Miss World Malaysia 2024

According to the New Straits Times, Taanusiya Chetty captivated judges and the audience with her stunning beauty, poise, and eloquence at the pageant finale on Tuesday night, 3 December.

She will represent Malaysia at the Miss World pageant next year, competing against contestants from around the globe

On Tuesday night, the beauty queen also took home RM50,000 in cash and prizes.

The pageant finale took place at the Sabah International Convention Centre (SICC) in Kota Kinabalu.

Kelly Eleanor Tseu, a Chinese-Filipino from Kota Kinabalu, and Hantze Liow, a Muay Thai and yoga enthusiast from Kuala Lumpur, were named first and second runners-up, respectively.

After the event, Taanusiya took to social media to thank her family and supporters for believing in her

"This moment is bigger than me — it's about the lives touched, the stories shared, and the hope for a brighter tomorrow," she wrote.

Besides pursuing a Bachelor of Education in Teaching English as a Second Language, the 24-year-old is also an influencer, model, and content creator.

"From facing profound loss to finding strength in giving back, this journey has been nothing short of life-changing. Every step — from founding @be.the.change_my to empowering underserved communities and championing children with disabilities — has shaped who I am today," she said.

She said she hopes to use her platform as Miss World Malaysia to amplify her purpose, and inspire others to recognise the power of kindness and education.

Watch a video of Taanusiya thanking her fans here:

These stunning beauty queens have also made us proud at other international pageants:

item.title: Lazada Brings 1-2-Jus Back With A Twist. Compete For State Pride & Win 120K Vouchers
item.tags: sponsored, saysspotlight, lazada, 1212, 12jus, nostalgic, game, statepride, state, malaysia, Lazada1212Showdown, LazadaMY1212Sale, LazadaMY, sponsored:lazada:051224
item.author: Jeremy Ng
item.description: Plus, don't miss out on daily vouchers!
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

This Spotlight is sponsored by Lazada.

Remember growing up playing '1, 2, Jus' in school?

Well, Lazada is reviving our classic childhood game with an exciting twist!

Introducing Lazada's 12.12 1-2-Jus Showdown! This year, Lazada's 12.12 All Out Sale comes with an exciting twist, where participants across the nation go head-to-head in a classic game of 1-2-Jus (rock-paper-scissors) to claim state pride and amazing rewards.

Here's how it works: Participants will get to play '1, 2 Jus' against the Queen's move on Lazada's microsite daily. Each participation and win contributes points to your state's leaderboard, and the winning state will share a voucher pool worth RM120,000, woah!

But that's not all. We even heard that some Lazada users received scratch cards in their mailbox, which allowed them to contribute higher points, giving their state an advantage in the leaderboard. Check your mailbox to see if you receive it!

If you're the first 50 participants who submits a move using a direct mailer scratch card, you also get an exclusive Lazada voucher too!

P.S. Even if you did not manage to snag one, you can also get a participation voucher. Wow – What a steal!

Here's a step-by-step guide to taking part in the Lazada 12.12 1-2-Jus Showdown:

STEP 1: Perform a Google search for 'Lazada 1212 Showdown' and click on the exclusive Lazada microsite.

STEP 2: Register with your name, email and birth state.

STEP 3: Choose a move (rock, paper, or scissors) to compete against the Queen's move.

STEP 4: Each submitted move will contribute 10 points to your registered state.

STEP 5: Tune in to Lazada Malaysia's Instagram (@LazadaMY), digital out-of-home screens across selected cities, or microsite at 8pm daily to view the Queen's move of the day.

STEP 6: Participants who beat the Queen's move of the day will contribute an additional 20 points to their registered state. The website will feature a leaderboard that will be updated at 8pm daily with each state's scores, so make sure you check daily and rally more friends to join!

*Each registered email address is limited to one submission per day. The daily challenge resets at 8pm. Participants can monitor the state leaderboard, updated live on the microsite.

The winning state will be announced on Lazada Malaysia's Instagram (<a target="blank" rel="nofollow">@Lazada_MY) on 10 December, so keep your eyes peeled. Plus, participants who contribute to the winning state's score will get their share of the RM120,000 voucher prize pool, yay!

So, which state will emerge as the ultimate Lazada 12.12 1,2 Jus Showdown champion to claim the nation's bragging rights and walk away with RM120,000 12.12 Lazada Vouchers?

It's up to you to decide, so rally your fellow Malaysians, spread the word, and join Lazada's 12.12 Showdown.

Google 'Lazada 1212 Showdown' today to represent your state, earn points, and win your share of the RM120,000 voucher prize pool! Don't forget to jio your friends to join the showdown and boost your state's chances of winning big! Contest ends 9 December, 8pm.

Also, don’t forget to switch to the better sale this 12.12 with Lazada's 12.12 All Out Sale! The early bird sale starts from 8 December at 8pm, and goes all the way till 11 December (7.59pm), while the 12.12 All Out Sale starts from 11 December (8pm) to 14 December.It will feature discounts of up to 90%, campaign vouchers worth up to RM1,212, and free shipping. Woah, so good! Start searching for ‘Lazada 12.12 Showdown’ now!

item.title: The 1st Rooftop Hot Pot Restaurant In KL Has Futuristic Domes Overlooking The City Skyline
item.tags: makan, hotpot, kl, feature, saysmakan, restaurant, sapotlokal, nonhalal
item.author: Tiffany Tay
item.description: A whole new world.
item.content:encoded:
Subscribe to our Telegram channel for our latest stories and breaking news.

UPDATED on 5 December 2024: This restaurant has permanently closed.

Located in the heart of KL is the first rooftop restaurant to serve delicious hot pot with an incredible 360° cityscape view

Sky-Dome Hotpot Restaurant is made up of classy geometric domes that span across the spacious rooftop terrace on Wisma Trax. The domes are well-ventilated and air-conditioned to ensure maximum comfort for everyone.

The main dining area can comfortably accommodate about 100 diners, whereas private VIP domes can be reserved for individual functions or smaller parties.

Hot pot fans will be delighted to know that Sky-Dome's broth is available in diverse flavours like spicy mala, tomato, coconut chicken, wild mushroom, and more

Their hot pot is served with three different choices of hearty soup bases, which cost around RM38 each. They currently have a happy hour promotion of RM69.90 for a two pax set, as well as student sets from just RM29.90 for two people.

Sky-Dome also serves a huge assortment of fresh ingredients like pork belly and pork collar slices, crispy beancurd rolls, baby octopus, and Australian Wagyu beef slices

With meat, seafood, handmade dumplings, vegetables, and even dessert, there's something to suit all kinds of taste preferences.

This is a great place to go if you want to impress your date with a romantic dining experience in a glass-like dome structure high above the city

Needless to say, the ambiance becomes extra dreamy during the golden hour, with incredible sunset views to be enjoyed from this bird's-eye position. You'll have plenty of OOTD photo opportunities here!

Planning a trip to the city? Don't forget to stop by Sky-Dome for a spectacular dinner you'll won't forget!

Opening hours:

4pm - 12am (Daily)

Address:

Wisma Trax, Level 13,

1, Jalan Lima, Chan Sow Lin,

55200 Kuala Lumpur, WPKL

Contact:

+6018-6680021 (WhatsApp)

Note that you'll need to make a reservation in advance.

Visit their Facebook and Instagram for more information.

If you're in the mood for a unique sky dining experience, here's a list of other places that are worth a visit:

Check out these other hot pot and steamboat places if you're craving a steaming bowl of aromatic broth:

item.title: Threads Is Upgrading Its Search Tools To Entice X Users
item.tags: technews, Tech, X, threads
item.author: Sukhbir Cheema
item.description: This move comes amid a wave of users leaving X (formerly Twitter).
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

﻿

Threads, Meta's text-based social app, is introducing new search tools in a clear attempt to stay competitive

The platform now allows users to refine their searches by profile and date range, a feature announced in a post on Threads’ official account.  

The update, which will be rolled out globally over the coming weeks, is already accessible to some users.

For those still waiting, the platform assures, "If you don’t see it yet, you will soon."  

This move comes amid a wave of users leaving X (formerly Twitter) following Elon Musk's controversial changes

While Bluesky appears to be the current favourite among disillusioned users, Threads is striving to remain in the conversation.  

Search refinement might feel like an overdue addition for a social media app, but Threads is steadily catching up.

Just recently, it adopted features reminiscent of Bluesky's community-driven "Starter Packs".﻿

As of September 2024, Threads boasts 200 million users

It needs another 400 million to overtake X. Bluesky, on the other hand, is home to over 24 million users.

Whether these updates are enough to entice users to give Threads a serious chance remains to be seen, but one thing is clear: Meta is banking on familiarity to win over the wandering masses.  

The question is, will this be enough to elevate Threads into the spotlight it so desperately seeks?  

Follow SAYS Tech on Facebook, Instagram, & TikTok for the latest in tech in Malaysia and the world!

Read more #tech stories:

item.title: K-Pop Group INFINITE Is Having A Concert In Malaysia To Celebrate Their 15th Anniversary
item.tags: Entertainment, Kpop, concert, music, liveinkl, infinite, boyband, singer, events, klah
item.author: Celine Low
item.description: Malaysian INSPIRITs, rejoice! They're back!
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

UPDATED on 5 December: Ticketing details have been announced.

After twelve long years, the beloved K-pop group INFINITE is finally making their return to Malaysia

From their debut hit Come Back Again to the iconic Be Mine and the infectious Bad, the group is known for their powerful vocals, synchronised dance moves, and catchy tunes.

The group, consisting of members Sung-kyu, Dong-woo, Woo-hyun, Sung-yeol, L, and Sung-jong, will be performing at Mega Star Arena on Saturday, 22 February 2025.

To celebrate their 15th anniversary, the six-member group will be performing in front of fans across several major cities in Asia, including Seoul, Taipei, Macau, Jakarta, Singapore, Yokohama, and Hong Kong.

Tickets go on sale on Friday, 13 December, from 12pm onwards

Here are the ticket prices and seating map:

- VIP: RM988

- ROCK 1: RM798

- ROCK 2: RM698

- P1: RM598

- P2: RM458

- P3: RM338

VIP ticket holders in the standing zone will enter according to the queue number assigned to their ticket, which indicates both batch and sequence, meanwhile ROCK 1 and ROCK 2 are free standing zones, so entry is first-come, first-served. Lastly, P1 to P3 zones offer numbered seating as indicated on your ticket.﻿

The event will be organised by Star Planet and fans will be able to enjoy exclusive fan benefits.

Plenty of artistes have announced concerts in Malaysia:

item.title: Catch Malaysia's Hottest Local Acts Live At Fly FM's Free Showcase At The Bee
item.tags: entertainment, music, concert, performance, FlyFM, thebee, publika, Aesix, LieslMae, TheDukes, Tydel
item.author: Gowri Chitra
item.description: The event features an exciting lineup, including Aesix, Liesl Mae, The Dukes, and TY:DEL.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.﻿

Fly FM is gearing up to light up the stage with its Fly Malaysia Live Showcase, celebrating Malaysian English music

Date: 13 December

Time: 7pm

Venue: The Bee, Publika

The event features an exciting lineup, including Aesix, Liesl Mae, The Dukes, and TY:DEL, promising a night of unforgettable live performances by some of Malaysia's most talented artistes.

Each act offers something unique: Aesix brings high-energy performances, Liesl Mae enchants with soulful melodies, The Dukes deliver their dynamic sound, and TY:DEL captivates with their unique artistry — all set against the intimate and vibrant backdrop of The Bee, Publika.

As part of the radio station's dedication to supporting the local music scene, the showcase highlights homegrown artistry, providing a platform for Malaysian artistes to connect with fans

Fly FM has also implemented initiatives like dedicating 25% of its playlist to local music, hosting live events, and launching the upcoming Fly Malaysia Awards, further solidifying its commitment to uplifting Malaysian English music.

"This isn't just about music; it's about giving local artistes the platform they deserve and bringing their talent closer to the community," said Seán Farrell Matjeraie, Content Director of Fly FM.

The best part is that the showcase is free to attend! You can secure your spots now by registering at FlyFM.audio.

Celebrate Malaysia's musical talent and be part of a night that showcases the best of local creativity!

Stay tuned to 95.8FM in the Klang Valley and follow Fly FM's social media pages on Instagram and TikTok for updates, exclusive content, and behind-the-scenes moments.

Check out how TY:DEL made an EP from their homes during the MCO:

item.title: Padel For A Cause: Raise Funds For Strays On 21 December By Playing Your Favourite Sport
item.tags: lifestyle, SAYSSupports, animals, padel, sports, charity, donate, trapreleaseneuter, strays, cats, dogs
item.author: Tamara Jayne
item.description: 100% of the proceeds will go to TNRM Malaysia.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.

Love padel? Love animals? Here's your chance to combine both passions!

Trap-Neuter-Release-Manage Malaysia (TNRM) invites you to its annual fundraiser, a charity padel tournament, that's taking place on Saturday, 21 December.  

It will be a day filled with exciting matches and an opportunity to make a difference in the lives of stray cats and dogs across Malaysia.

TNRM Malaysia is a non-profit organisation that has been making a difference since 2013. Their mission is to humanely manage Malaysia's stray animal population through its trap-neuter-release-manage (TNRM) programmes.

This involves trapping stray dogs and cats, ensuring they're neutered and vaccinated, and releasing them back into their communities where feeders care for them post-surgery. This sustainable method helps control the stray population effectively.

To support the cause and aid our furry friends, TNRM is hosting this charity padel tournament

Event details

Date: 21 December (Saturday)

Time: 8am - 11pm

Location: Joy Division Padel

Entry Fee: RM200 per person per category (RM400 per team per category)

Whether you're a padel newbie or an experienced player, there's a category for you:

Each category is limited to 10 teams, so sign up fast!

Not only will you get to enjoy a full day of padel, but you'll also be supporting TNRM's vital work

Plus, there are bragging rights, medals, prizes, lucky draws, and more up for grabs!

Ready to make a difference while having a smashing time? Simply Wha﻿tsApp +6012-9696573 to register.

Even if you don't play padel, you can still support TNRM's cause here:

Another way to help stray animals is by donating to this fun "Neuter Your Ex" cause:

A pet sanctuary in Langkawi is in urgent need of funds as it must relocate to a new location by the end of this year:

Adopt, don't shop! With so many furry friends in need of a home, let's consider adoption instead of buying:

For more ways to support your community:

item.title: Lip Care, Candles & More: 9 Christmas Gifts To Buy For Your Loved Ones
item.tags: Lifestyle, Christmas, shopping, giftsets, festiveseason, gifts, presents, christmas2024, sapotllokal, SAYSBuyWhat
item.author: Celine Low
item.description: Fa-la-la-fabulous presents.
item.content:encoded:
Follow us on Instagram, TikTok, and WhatsApp for the latest stories and breaking news.﻿

1. Wunderbath

Perfect for pampering loved ones (or yourself!), Wunderbath's Christmas collection offers festive bath bombs, decadent scrubs, and nourishing soaps.

Imagine using their whimsical bath bombs to soak in a tub infused with the aroma of a Christmas tree. For a truly decadent experience, indulge in their Sugar Plum Body Sugar Scrub Sorbet, leaving your skin feeling soft and smooth.

Check out the Christmas Wunderland collection here.

2. Bath & Body Works

Just in time for the holidays, Bath & Body Works has released its highly anticipated Christmas collection. It offers festive scents in candles, lotions, body washes, fragrance mists, hand creams, and bath fizzies.

Shop here.

3. Tangan Jewellery

This Christmas, embrace the spirit of Malaysian craftsmanship with thoughtfully curated gift boxes showcasing local artistry. Starting from just RM38, each gift box features a beautiful pair of batik stud earrings and a coin pouch, handcrafted with intricate designs and vibrant colours.

Check out Tangan Jewellery's Christmas collection here.

4. Glittery Daisyy Handmade

Glittery Daisyy Handmade is a Penang-based business selling unique, handcrafted polymer clay earrings. With four holly-jolly collections, you can choose from cute and colourful pieces inspired by gingerbread men, cookies, and candy canes, or opt for timeless elegance with ginkgo leaves in festive red and green. For a touch of wintery charm, check out their snowflake-inspired blue collection.

All their earrings are made from surgical stainless steel, which is perfect for sensitive ears! They also provide shipping within Malaysia with a flat rate of RM7.

5. ArtsiE Handcrafts

Adorn yourself with charming earrings inspired by the spirit of the season, all handcrafted by ArtsiE Handcrafts. These delicate accessories feature designs of festive motifs, including miniature Christmas trees, shelves, floral basket wreaths, floral prints, bows, and many more.

Find their full Christmas collection here.

6. Borneo Candle Studio

Handcrafted with 100% soy wax, Borneo Candle Studio offers vegan, paraffin-free, and phthalate-free candles to fill your home with festive cheer. Each beautifully packaged set includes a scented candle with a 10-15 hour burn time, available in three limited edition fragrances: Winter Solstice (Christmas tree), Spiced Berry, and Ember Daze (a Borneo-inspired winter fireplace).

Pick from 3.5oz (approximately 104ml) or 7.7oz (228ml) sizes to suit your space and enjoy the elegant ambiance of these holiday favourites.

Buy here.

7. LIPS CARPENTER

Get that perfect pout this Christmas with LIPS CARPENTER. Their curated gift sets feature a selection of lip-care essentials, including lip masks, scrubs, balms, and tinted balms, ensuring soft, smooth, and luscious lips all day long. These sets make the perfect gift for beauty enthusiasts or a delightful treat for yourself.

8. The Tea Republic

If you or your loved ones enjoy drinking tea, The Tea Republic has personalised tea gifts tailored to their tastes. Choose from their seasonal Apple Pie tea blend, their popular Pyramid Gift Boxes, or create your own custom blend. 

9. Awan Bedsheets

Awan Bedsheets is ushering in the holiday season with a special Christmas sale and the launch of their stunning new color, Dove Grey! Enjoy dreamy sleepwear in soft, luxurious fabrics, perfect for gifting or treating yourself.

As a special holiday treat, use code 'HOHOHO' at the checkout and receive a complimentary pillowcase worth RM50 with any purchase above RM200. Simply add your desired pillowcase colour to your cart.

This offer is valid until 31 December, and limited to one use per customer. Don't miss out on this opportunity to elevate your sleepwear collection with Awan's exquisite comfort and style.

Shop here.

'Tis the time to prepare for Christmas, here are some places to shop:

If you need more inspo for Christmas gifts, we got you covered:
